thread.title: Exhibit spotlights Midcentury Modern in Pennsylvania
thread.title_full: Exhibit spotlights Midcentury Modern in Pennsylvania

author: JENNIFER KOPF | Staff Writer
title: Exhibit spotlights Midcentury Modern in Pennsylvania
text:
Coca-Cola building, Lancaster, 2015. By Andrew Hoff, Cumberland County BEN LEECH 
339 N. Duke St., the offices of Kluxen, Newcomer & Dreisbach, Attorneys at Law, Lancaster. BEN LEECH 
Yorgey's Dry Cleaner, Mountville. JAMES McMAHON JR. 
Limestone and Marble 2015 | Founders Hall, Milton Hershey School, Hershey | Built: 1970 | Architects Clifford and Melissa Coleman Exhibit spotlights Midcentury Modern in Pennsylvania State Museum features work of 3 Lancaster photographers 
Coca-Cola Bottling Plant, Lancaster, 2015 JEFF WILES 
Fleet Wing, A&W Jewelry, Lancaster, 2015. By Jeff Wiles, Dauphin County. ERIC WEEKS 
Coca-Cola building, Lancaster, 2015. By Andrew Hoff, Cumberland County BEN LEECH 
339 N. Duke St., the offices of Kluxen, Newcomer & Dreisbach, Attorneys at Law, Lancaster. BEN LEECH 
Yorgey's Dry Cleaner, Mountville. JAMES McMAHON JR. 
Limestone and Marble 2015 | Founders Hall, Milton Hershey School, Hershey | Built: 1970 | Architects Clifford and Melissa Coleman 
The work of three Lancaster-area photographers has been chosen for a State Museum of Pennsylvania photo exhibit that opens later this month. 
Ben Leech, James McMahon Jr. and Eric Weeks will be part of "The Pennsylvania Modern: A Juried Photography Exhibit of Midcentury Modern Architecture," which documents buildings often hiding "in plain sight." 
In addition, two photographers, Andrew Hoff of Cumberland County and Jeff Wiles of Dauphin County, have images of Lancaster sites included in the exhibit. 
The statewide juried competition challenged artists to submit photos of buildings created between 1930 and 1980, and nearly 100 photos have been chosen, representing 26 cities and towns, including Lancaster. 
It was organized in recognition of the 50th anniversary of The State Museum and Archives Complex. Click through our gallery above to see the photos of Lancaster locations and works by Lancaster photographers which will be part of "The Pennsylvania Modern." Tags
